com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.sqlite.impl
Class SqliteTemplate

java.lang.Object
  com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.sqlite.impl.SqliteTemplate
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatastoreOperations, SqliteOperations
public class SqliteTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
implements SqliteOperations

An implementation of SqliteOperations. This class is designed to provide implementations of core CRUD operations for interacting with a SQLite database and act as a factory for constructing Criteria and Criteria queries.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0 02/11/12
Author:
Tyler Treat

beginTransaction

public void beginTransaction()
Description copied from interface: SqliteOperations
Starts a new database transaction. If autocommit is enabled, invoking this method will have no effect. A transaction must be committed or rolled back by calling SqliteOperations.commit() or SqliteOperations.rollback(), respectively.

Specified by:
beginTransaction in interface SqliteOperations

commit

public void commit()
Description copied from interface: SqliteOperations
Commits the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.

Specified by:
commit in interface SqliteOperations

rollback

public void rollback()
Description copied from interface: SqliteOperations
Rolls back the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.

Specified by:
rollback in interface SqliteOperations

setAutocommit

public void setAutocommit(boolean autocommit)
Description copied from interface: SqliteOperations
Sets the autocommit value for this SqliteOperations. If autocommit is enabled, a transaction must be initiated by invoking SqliteOperations.beginTransaction(). A transaction must then be committed or rolled back by calling SqliteOperations.commit() or SqliteOperations.rollback(), respectively. If autocommit is disabled, database operations will be committed when they are executed.

Specified by:
setAutocommit in interface SqliteOperations
Parameters:
autocommit - true to enable autocommit, false to disable it

isAutocommit

public boolean isAutocommit()
Description copied from interface: SqliteOperations
Indicates if autocommit is enabled or disabled.

Specified by:
isAutocommit in interface SqliteOperations
Returns:
true if autocommit is enabled, false if not

save

public long save(java.lang.Object model)
          throws InfinitumRuntimeException
Description copied from interface: DatastoreOperations
Persists the given Object to the database. This method is not idempotent, meaning if the record already exists, a new one will attempt to persist.

Specified by:
save in interface DatastoreOperations
Parameters:
model - Object to persist to the database
Returns:
the row ID of the newly inserted record, or -1 if the insert failed
Throws:
InfinitumRuntimeException - if the model is marked transient

registerTypeAdapter

public <T> void registerTypeAdapter(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                    SqliteTypeAdapter<T> adapter)
Description copied from interface: SqliteOperations
Registers the given TypeAdapter for the specified Class with this SqliteMapper instance. The TypeAdapter allows a Field of this type to be mapped to a database column. Registering a TypeAdapter for a Class which already has a TypeAdapter registered for it will result in the previous TypeAdapter being overridden.

Specified by:
registerTypeAdapter in interface SqliteOperations
Parameters:
type - the Class this TypeAdapter is for
adapter - the TypeAdapter to register

getRegisteredTypeAdapters

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,SqliteTypeAdapter<?>> getRegisteredTypeAdapters()
Description copied from interface: SqliteOperations
Returns a Map containing all SqliteTypeAdapter instances registered with this Session and the Class instance in which they are registered for.

Specified by:
getRegisteredTypeAdapters in interface SqliteOperations
Returns:
{@code Map, SqliteTypeAdapter>
